subtask.title: Define and categorize AI agents
subtask.objective: Identify and describe different types of AI agents (e.g., autonomous agents, conversational agents) and their core characteristics.
subtask.scope: Overview of AI agent types, their architectures, and functional distinctions.

verification.completion_summary: The collected findings focus heavily on enterprise AI agents, automation, web-based functionalities, and specific examples like coding assistants. While they describe various types and characteristics of AI agents, the coverage is predominantly centered on enterprise and automation contexts, with limited explicit categorization of AI agent types (e.g., autonomous vs. conversational) or core characteristics beyond automation and integration. The scope of overview, architectures, and functional distinctions is only partially addressed.

covered_aspects: Examples of different AI agent types (e.g., coding agents, web agents)
Core characteristics such as automation, integration, autonomy
Discussion of enterprise AI strategies and deployment
missing_aspects: Explicit definitions and detailed categorization of AI agent types (e.g., autonomous, conversational, hybrid)
Clear functional distinctions between various types
Broader scope beyond enterprise and coding contexts

missing_requirements: Explicit categorization of AI agent types
Broader overview beyond enterprise use cases
